name: Banded Glute Bridge

instructions.description: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor, hip-width apart. Place a resistance band above your knees.
Press your knees slightly outward against the band to create tension and engage the hip abductors.
Engage your core and squeeze your glutes. Press through your heels to lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
Maintain outward pressure on the band at the top position while keeping hips level.
Lower your hips slowly back to the floor with control while maintaining band tension.

performanceMetrics.notes: Typically performed for moderate repetitions with constant band tension.

Use light to medium resistance bands depending on strength level.
Increased lateral hip activation; breathing should remain controlled.

commentsNotes: Keep constant outward pressure on the band throughout the movement.
Avoid letting knees collapse inward, especially at the top position.
Reduce band resistance if hip or knee discomfort occurs.
Warm up glutes and hips before performing this exercise.
